<u>Connections of the corpus Callosum with 
the middle part of the Brain <\u>.
<s>With the middle <\s> The convolutions included in this are 
the origins of the 1st & 2nd frontal, the ascending frontal, ascending parietal, the gyrus 
supra-marginalis, <s>and <\s> the anterior parts of the three 
temporal as well as corresponding parts of the gyrus 
occipito temporalis medialis, gyrus occipito-temporalis lateralis,
gyrus hippocampi, & gyrus uncinatus.
[As I have before stated the callosal fibres after crossing 
end in great part in the thalamus opticus. Now as the thal-
amus corresponds in most of its extent <s>to the one in 
in perpendicular section <\s> to the region at present under consideration <s>above referred to <\s>,
it follows that those fibres coming down from the 
convolutions at the vertex will not have to pursue 
such an <s>circuitous <\s>   oblique course as those coming from 
before & behind. In the description of the front part 
of the brain just given are left the crossed fibres 
comprised <s>mainly <\s> in the inner capsule coming obliquely 
backwards towards the thalamus. <s>Here, however,<\s>
In this region, however, the <s>corresponding <\s> fibres to the above after crossing the corpus callosum <s>they <\s> turn with very 
little obliquity in their course directly into the 
thalamus.
